button.buttonText: Is my gout out of control? Quiz2

links.linkTxt: Is my gout out of control?

paragraph.paraTxt: You’re taking gout medicines and still have a high uric acid level (above 6 mg/dL)
Either you have more than one flare a year
Or you have at least one visible lump (tophus) on your body

subHeadingIsi.headingTxt: What is the most important information I should know about KRYSTEXXA (pegloticase)?

paragraph.paraTxt: Serious allergic reactions may happen in some patients who receive KRYSTEXXA. These allergic reactions can be life threatening and usually happen within 2 hours of the infusion.

isiTop.headingTxt: What is the most important information I should know about KRYSTEXXA (pegloticase)?

paragraph.paraTxt:
Serious allergic reactions may happen in some patients who receive KRYSTEXXA. These allergic reactions can be life threatening and usually happen within 2 hours of the infusion.

KRYSTEXXA should be given to you by a doctor or nurse in a healthcare setting where serious allergic reactions can be treated. Your doctor or nurse should watch you for any signs of a serious allergic reaction during and after your treatment with KRYSTEXXA.

Tell your doctor or nurse right away if you have any of these symptoms during or after your treatment with KRYSTEXXA:

list.listItem: Wheezing, shortness of breath, cough, chest tightness, chest pain, or trouble breathing
Dizziness, fainting, fast or weak heartbeat or feeling nervous
Reddening of the face, itching, hives, rash, or feeling warm
Swelling of the throat or tongue, throat tightness, hoarse voice or trouble swallowing

paragraph.paraTxt:
Do not receive KRYSTEXXA if you have a rare blood problem called glucose 6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency or favism. Your doctor should test you for G6PD before you start KRYSTEXXA.

KRYSTEXXA is not recommended if you have high levels of uric acid without a history of gout.

Before you receive KRYSTEXXA, tell your doctor if you:

list.listItem: Ever had any heart problems or high blood pressure
Are pregnant or planning to become pregnant. It is not known if KRYSTEXXA will harm your unborn baby
Are breastfeeding or plan to breastfeed. It is not known if KRYSTEXXA passes into your breast milk

paragraph.paraTxt:
Tell your doctor about all the medicines you take.Do not take any other uric acid lowering drug, such as allopurinol or febuxostat (Uloric®), while taking KRYSTEXXA.

Prior to your treatment with KRYSTEXXA, your doctor may give you medicine to help reduce your chance of getting a reaction.Take these medicines as directed by your doctor or nurse. Your doctor will also test your uric acid levels prior to each treatment to monitor your response to KRYSTEXXA

isiBottom.headingTxt: What are the possible side effects of KRYSTEXXA?

paragraph.paraTxt:
Please review important information section above. The most common side effects in patients taking KRYSTEXXA were gout flare-ups or attacks, allergic reactions, nausea, bruising, sore throat, constipation, chest pain, and vomiting.

This is not a complete list of all possible side effects. Tell your doctor or treatment team if you have any side effect that bothers you or that does not go away.

Please see the Medication Guide and Prescribing Information for more information. You are encouraged to report negative side effects of prescription drugs to the FDA. Visit www.fda.gov/safety/medwatch, or call the FDA at 1-800-FDA-1088.

list.listItem: CONVERT URIC ACID: Only KRYSTEXXA changes uric acid into a water-soluble substance called allantonin that your body can easily can get rid of through urine.
LOWER URIC ACID LEVEL IN 24 HOURS: After just one IV treatment,KRYSTEXXA lowers your uric acid level enough to start dissolving years of harmful uric acid crystal buildup

COMPLETELY DISSOLVE GOUT BUILDUP: It can take more than two years for iroal gout medicines to dissolve even a small amount of uric acid crystal buildup.KRYSTEXXA can dissolve all of it in about 6 months.

numberedBoxesHeader.headingTxt: How KRYSTEXXA releases your life from gout

paragraph.paraTxt: People with out-of-control chronic gout can’t get their uric acid level low enough, causing uric acid crystals to build up.
Healthy kidneys can only get rid of about 10% of the uric acid they process, and oral gout medicines may not lower uric acid levels enough to dissolve uric acid crystal buildup.
KRYSTEXXA has the unique ability to change uric acid into a water-soluble substance called allantoin that your body can easily get rid of through urine.
Without all that uric acid in your body, you can dissolve 100% of gout buildup, stop the threat of gout attacks, and take back your life.
Several steps are built into the KRYSTEXXA <u>treatment process</u> to help ensure the best results:

list.listItem: A blood test will tell your doctor if you have a genetic condition known as a G6PD deficiency or favism and shouldn’t start KRYSTEXXA.
Before you start KRYSTEXXA, your doctor may prescribe medicine to treat flares that could happen when gout buildup starts to dissolve.
Before each IV treatment, you’ll receive a blood test to make sure you can safely continue KRYSTEXXA.
During and after each IV treatment, you’ll be closely monitored for any sign of side effects.

paragraph.paraTxt: Answer a few short questions to see if KRYSTEXXA may be right for you.
When uric acid levels remain high, uric acid crystals accumulate in your joints and cause damage.
THE AVERAGE URIC ACID LEVEL OF PATIENTS WHO RESPONDED TO KRYSTEXXA WAS1 mg/dL.THE LOWER YOUR URIC ACID LEVEL, THE FASTER GOUT BUILDUP DISSOLVES.
KEPT THEIR URIC ACID LEVELBELOW 6 mg/dL FOR 6 MONTHS OR MORE.THE REST OF THE PATIENTS WERE ABLE TO KEEP THEIR URIC ACID LEVEL BELOW THE GOAL OF 6 mg/dL FOR AN AVERAGE OF 7 WEEKS.
HAD ONE VISIBLE LUMP (TOPHUS) COMPLETELY DISAPPEAR IN 6 MONTHS.IN THESE SAME PATIENTS,THERE WAS NO NEW TOPHI GROWTH.

NSAIDs (ibuprofen and naproxen)

Steroids/corticosteroids like prednisone

Colcrys (colchicine)

imgTxtCtaMulticolumnV2.headingTxt: Medicines that limit uric acid PRODUCTION include:

paragraph.paraTxt:
Zyloprim (allopurinol)

Uloric (febuxostat)

imgTxtCtaMulticolumnV2.headingTxt: the only medicine that removes years of uric acid crystal buildup:

paragraph.paraTxt: KRYSTEXXA (pegloticase)

toggleLink.linkTxt: How do i know if my gout is out of control

paragraph.paraTxt: If you take oral gout medicine and still experience gout symptoms, your gout may be out-of-control. Your flares may also become more frequent and severe, spread to other joints, or you may develop visible lumps of uric acid crystal buildup. Take a short quiz

toggleLink.linkTxt: What happens if gout stays out of control?

paragraph.paraTxt: In addition to more frequent and severe gout flares, out-of-control chronic gout has been linked to serious health issues, including heart attack, stroke, and insulin resistance. Lumps of uric acid crystal buildup called tophi that develop over time could become infected and life threatening.

Gout is caused by too much uric acid in your blood. It’s not a result of your diet, though certain foods can trigger a gout attack. Over time, uric acid crystals form and settle in your joints. If your gout remains out of control, it could lead to permanent joint and bone damage.

toggleLink.linkTxt: What causes Uric acid to build up

paragraph.paraTxt: Uric acid is produced when your body breaks down purines found naturally in your body and in certain foods. Normally, uric acid dissolves in your blood and is excreted through your kidneys. However, if you produce too much uric acid, or excrete too little, the uric acid will form into tiny needle-like crystals that settle in your joints and surrounding tissue. KRYSTEXXA works differently to remove uric acid.

toggleLink.linkTxt: What are the signs of gout

paragraph.paraTxt: When uric acid crystals accumulate in your joints, it can cause inflammation, redness, swelling, tenderness and intense pain. Your doctor will test your uric acid level to determine whether or not your symptoms are the result of gout.

toggleLink.linkTxt: Can Gout travel from one joint to another?

paragraph.paraTxt: Over time, uric acid crystals can accumulate in new areas of your body, causing you to experience flares and damage in more places. That’s one sign your gout is out of control.

Tophi (TOE-f-EYE) are hard lumps of uric acid crystal that build up so much they become visible. The big toe is a common place to develop tophi, but they can also form on your hands, elbows, knees and almost anywhere, even on your organs. Everyone is at risk of developing tophi if gout stays out of control for too long.

Gout doesn’t ever really go away. Even when you’re not having a flare, you still have the underlying condition that causes gout. Take control of chronic gout by dissolving uric acid crystal buildup and keeping your uric acid level low enough to prevent new buildup.

The longer uric acid continues to build up in your body, the more at risk you are of permanently damaging your joints and bones. KRYSTEXXA is the only treatment for chronic gout that’s proven to stop gout buildup and damage when oral treatments can’t.

toggleLink.linkTxt: Why can’t I take KRYSTEXXA as a pill?

paragraph.paraTxt: KRYSTEXXA is a delicate enzyme that would be destroyed in your stomach if taken as a pill.

toggleLink.linkTxt: Do I have to get KRYSTEXXA IV TREATMENT EVERY 2 weeks?

paragraph.paraTxt: Yes. People in the clinical studies had the best results when they were given KRYSTEXXA every 2 weeks.

toggleLink.linkTxt: Do I still take my other gout medicine(s) with KRYSTEXXA?

paragraph.paraTxt: While taking KRYSTEXXA, do not take any other uric acid lowering drugs, such as allopurinol or febuxostat (Uloric®). Your doctor or gout specialist may give you medicine (colchicine and/or NSAIDs) to help with any gout flares you may have while on KRYSTEXXA. In preparation for your KRYSTEXXA IV treatment, your doctor may also give you antihistamines and corticosteroids.

toggleLink.linkTxt: What happens if I miss an IV treatment?

paragraph.paraTxt: Making time for your IV treatments can be challenging, but in order to see the best results with KRYSTEXXA, it’s important to receive your IV treatment every 2 weeks. If you are going to miss an appointment, contact your doctor or gout specialist as soon as possible to reschedule.

toggleLink.linkTxt: When will I start seeing results with KRYSTEXXA?

paragraph.paraTxt: KRYSTEXXA starts working within 24 hours. People in the clinical studies were given KRYSTEXXA for 6 months in order to stay in the dissolve zone to get rid of years of uric acid crystal buildup.

toggleLink.linkTxt: What happens after I finish taking KRYSTEXXA?

paragraph.paraTxt: You and your doctor will decide on a plan to keep uric acid crystals from building up again.

toggleLink.linkTxt: Will I have gout flares while taking KRYSTEXXA?

paragraph.paraTxt: With KRYSTEXXA, gout flares are a common side effect, but many people in the clinical studies said they were having fewer flares by the end of treatment. Your doctor may give you medicine (colchicine and/or NSAIDs) to help with any gout flares you may have while on KRYSTEXXA.

toggleLink.linkTxt: What happens if I have an allergic reaction?

paragraph.paraTxt: A nurse or assistant will be with you to ensure any allergic reactions are treated. In the clinical studies, all allergic reaction, including serious allergic reactions, were treated at the IV treatment center with medicine or by stopping the IV treatment. Most were resolved using common medications such as Benadryl®.

Whether you learned about KRYSTEXXA from your doctor or a Google search, Gout Nurse Advocates can help you better understand out-of-control chronic gout and how KRYSTEXXA may help. Gout Nurse Advocates do not provide individual patient care or medical advice.
Reach out Monday - Friday 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM ET at 833-469-4688.

As soon as your doctor or gout specialist prescribes KRYSTEXXA and confirms your insurance coverage, you can connect with a dedicated Patient Access Manager (PAM) as much or as little as you’d like for help navigating your coverage and learning what to expect before and after each KRYSTEXXA IV treatment.
Uric acid crystals can build up almost anywhere in your body. This means damage can even happen in areas where you never had a flare.

Green areas represent uric acid crystal buildup.
Artist’s rendition.
Uric acid crystal buildup can permanently damage your joints and erode your bones.
X-ray of an actual patient.

textWithImage.headingTxt: OTHER MEDICINES MAY LOWER YOUR URIC ACID LEVEL, BUT NOT ENOUGH TO DISSOLVE GOUT BUILDUP

paragraph.paraTxt: In order to dissolve gout buildup, your uric acid level needs to be in the dissolve zone (under 6 mg/dL).

One study showed that approximately half of patients taking a standard oral gout medicine such as allopurinol or febuxostat are still unable to reach a uric acid level of 6 mg/dL or lower.* As long as you have gout buildup, you continue to be at risk of gout damage and flares.
ASK YOUR DOCTOR OR GOUT SPECIALIST WHAT YOUR URIC ACID LEVEL IS. THE NORMAL RANGE FOR PEOPLE WHO DON’T HAVE GOUT IS:
Adult males and postmenopausal women
Premenopausal women
Your uric acid level is the amount of uric acid in your blood measured in milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL).

Deanna, a former nurse, is passionate about working side-by-side with her patients to ensure they get the treatment they need. <sup>“</sup>I respect and recognize that patients CHOOSE to allow us to be a part of their treatment story.<sup>”</sup>

Kelly helped multiple sclerosis patients for 25 years. Now she’s dedicated to educating patients about gout, gout damage, and what to expect from KRYSTEXXA. <sup>“</sup>Its extremely rewarding to get a <sup>‘</sup>thank you<sup>’</sup> on a daily basis for helping and caring.<sup>”</sup>

Jeanne, a former cardiac nurse, is devoted to supporting her patients every step of the way. <sup>“</sup>Before KRYSTEXXA, many patients think, <sup>‘</sup>this is as good as it gets.<sup>’</sup> Hearing the words, <sup>‘</sup>KRYSTEXXA has changed my life<sup>’</sup> makes me feel amazing.<sup>”</sup>
